column1: Mascouche is an off-island suburb of Montreal
column3: Canada. The city is located on the Mascouche River within the Les Moulins Regional County Municipality and has a population of 42

column1: The name comes from Algonquin word maskutchew meaning "bear plain" in singular. Compare plular form to maskutew for the Les Maskoutains Regional County Municipality located nearby.
Mascouche received city status on December 9

column2: the largest regional airport in Quebec
column3: is three kilometres southeast of the city.
meet just south of the centre of the city.

column1: Mascouche is connected to Montreal's Central Station by commuter rail via the Mascouche station of the Réseau de transport métropolitain's Mascouche line.

column2: an urban park situated in the city centre on Mascouche Boulevard
column3: has the same area as Mount Royal Park in Montreal.

column1: The Commission scolaire des Affluents operates Francophone public schools. They include:
École secondaire Du CoteauOne professional school
Sir Wilfrid Laurier School Board operates Anglophone public schools:
Pinewood Elementary School in Mascouche serves the western portion
Franklin Hill Elementary School in Repentigny serves the eastern portion
Rosemere High School (all areas) in Rosemere
Mascouche is the hometown of baseball player Éric Gagné.
It is also Émilie Mondor's hometown
